noun.description: Chiefly Palaeontology. Especially in a fish: a bone or bony plate located anterior to the nasal bone in the snout.
Zoology. In a reptile: a scale on the head immediately in front of the nostril.

adjective.description: Zoology and Anatomy. Located in front of the nose, the nostrils, or the nasal region.
Linguistics. Occurring before a nasal consonant; characterized by prenasalization.

origin: Mid 19th century. From pre- + nasal. Compare postnasal, postnasal.
